title: 113_s555
content: The Act may be cited as the "Captioning and Image Narration to Enhance Movie Accessibility Act" or the "CINEMA Act". It focuses on improving movie theater accessibility. The Americans with Disabilities Act of 1990 is amended to include a new section on movie theater accessibility, defining closed captioning for individuals who are deaf or hard of hearing. The Americans with Disabilities Act of 1990 is amended to include closed captioning for individuals who are deaf or hard of hearing in movie theaters. This allows the audio portion of the movie to be displayed as text for better accessibility. The term 'entity' refers to a business operating multiple movie theaters or similar venues at one location, open to the public and affecting commerce. 'Open captioning' is a method that enables individuals who are deaf or hard of hearing to access content. The term 'entity' refers to a business operating multiple movie theaters or similar venues at one location, open to the public and affecting commerce. Open captioning allows individuals who are deaf or hard of hearing to access the audio portion of a motion picture by displaying it as text on the screen. Video description is a method that allows blind or visually impaired individuals to access key visual elements of a motion picture through audio. The provision of audio narrated descriptions during natural pauses in a motion picture is required for accessibility to individuals with disabilities, including open captioning for the deaf or hard of hearing. The Act requires providing closed captioning and video description for individuals with disabilities, including those who are deaf, hard of hearing, blind, or visually impaired. Individuals with disabilities are not limited in using technology for accessing closed captioning, open captioning, or video description on personal devices. The Act mandates closed captioning and video description for individuals with disabilities, including those who are deaf, hard of hearing, blind, or visually impaired, with access to technology for captioning and description on personal devices. The Americans with Disabilities Act of 1990 is amended to include section 302(b)(3) and the effective date of the Act is one year after enactment.
